pull.title: doc: suggest using timeoutstopsec in systemd file during IBD
pull.body: A naive user may run into trouble when using the provided systemd service file. By default, systemd will kill a process if it hasn't stopped after 90 seconds, which may be to short during Initial Block Download. This PR adds a suggestion to increase the timeout during IBD.

events.message: Add note about TimeoutStopSec during IBD

events.body: You mean that during IBD it doesn't quit with SIGINT within 90sec?

> You mean that during IBD it doesn't quit with SIGINT within 90sec?

Yes, it may not. Especially with slow hardware and/or large dbcache (which is often recommended for IBD).

events.body:
Perhaps the default value should be changed?

What would be a reasonable default for `TimeoutStopSec` that can be expected to work also during IBD in the general case?

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16569](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16569.html) (Increase init file stop timeout by setpill)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Maybe the default timestopsec value should be changed in another PR?
This could get merged for now.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,8 @@ To test, run `systemctl start bitcoind` and to enable for system startup run
 
 NOTE: When installing for systemd in Debian/Ubuntu the .service file needs to be copied to the /lib/systemd/system directory instead.
 
+NOTE: Systemd can be very agressive in killing processes that don't stop in a reasonable amount of time. This can be a problem during Initial Block Download where it can take several minutes to flush cached data to disk. Therefore consider adding `TimeoutStopSec=infinity` to the file during IBD.
comments.body: I don't mean to be aggressive but you're missing a "g" in "aggressive"111

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,6 +86,8 @@ To test, run `systemctl start bitcoind` and to enable for system startup run
 
 NOTE: When installing for systemd in Debian/Ubuntu the .service file needs to be copied to the /lib/systemd/system directory instead.
 
+NOTE: Systemd can be very agressive in killing processes that don't stop in a reasonable amount of time. This can be a problem during Initial Block Download where it can take several minutes to flush cached data to disk. Therefore consider adding `TimeoutStopSec=infinity` to the file during IBD.
